newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Saab in agreement with Airbus on the A3XX.
newsitem.headline: Saab in agreement with Airbus on the A3XX.

text.p: Swedish airplane manufacturer Saab AB said Monday it signed an agreement with Airbus Industrie for the study phase of the A3XX plane project.
"We are in it from the start," Saab spokesman Anders Annerfalk told Reuters. "The aim is for us to join as a full member."
Saab expects to spend 5 million to 10 million crowns (up to $1.3 million) on evaluating the project and on looking into which parts of the plane Saab should be responsible for.
The concept phase will last about one year and further involvement in the project will be the subject of renewed negotiations, Saab said.
Saab might step in as a partner with about a 5 percent share of the plane's body, corresponding to investment and development costs of around 2 billion crowns ($262.4 million), Annerfalk said,

Airbus plans to launch the A3XX, which should be able to carry 550-600 passengers, in time for service entry in 2003. Annerfalk added that Saab intends to take part in more large airplane cooperation projects.
"Today we have a cooperation with Boeing that could be developed further," he said.
